Experimental.h

00001 /**********************************************************************
00002 
00003   Audacity: A Digital Audio Editor
00004 
00005   Experimental.h
00006 
00007   Dominic Mazzoni
00008   James Crook
00009 
00010   Used for includes and #defines for experimental features.
00011 
00012   When the features become mainstream the include files will 
00013   move out of here and into the files which need them.  The
00014   #defines will then be retired.
00015 
00016 
00017 
00018   JKC: This file solves a problem of how to avoid forking the
00019   code base when working on new features e.g:
00020     - Additional displays in Audacity
00021     - Modular architecture.
00022   Add #defines in here for the new features, and make your code
00023   conditional on those #defines.
00024 
00025 **********************************************************************/
00026 
00027 #ifndef __EXPERIMENTAL__
00028 #define __EXPERIMENTAL__
00029 
00030 //Uncomment the next #define to enable experimental features.
00031 #define EXPERIMENTAL_FEATURES
00032 
00033 // Comment out the next two lines if you want to disable 'experimental theming'
00034 // Work in progress, June-2008.
00035 //#define EXPERIMENTAL_THEMING
00036 #define EXPERIMENTAL_THEME_PREFS
00037 
00038 //The next few enable different kinds of label/wavetrack pairing.
00039 //You should probably only enable one at a time.
00040 //The next line enables a menu-based system
00041 //#define EXPERIMENTAL_STICKY_TRACKS
00042 //The next block enables a positional-based system.
00043 //LABEL_LINKING only links label tracks, while FULL_LINKING links wave and label tracks
00044 #define EXPERIMENTAL_POSITION_LINKING
00045 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_POSITION_LINKING
00046    #define EXPERIMENTAL_FULL_LINKING
00047    //#define EXPERIMENTAL_LABEL_LINKING
00048 #endif
00049 
00050 //Next line enables Mic monitoring at times when it was previously off.
00051 //More work is needed as after recording or playing it results in an 
00052 //unwanted record-cursor on the wave track.
00053 //#define EXPERIMENTAL_EXTRA_MONITORING
00054 
00055 //#define EXPERIMENTAL_ROLL_UP_DIALOG
00056 //#define RIGHT_ALIGNED_TEXTBOXES
00057 //#define EXPERIMENTAL_VOICE_DETECTION
00058 
00059 //uncomment this line to enable On-Demand loading of PCM files.  
00060 //for now it is incomplete so it will load instantly but 
00061 //the display of summary data will not be there (one can still see sample data if zoomed in)
00062 #define EXPERIMENTAL_ONDEMAND
00063 
00064 //FFmpeg integration. Some FFmpeg-related changes are NOT ifdef'ed,
00065 //as they are harmless (like - a few mockup methods in Import* classes)
00066 // To enable ffmpeg support #define USE_FFMPEG in config*.h, as for any other
00067 // optional importer library (windows users: edit win/configwin.h)
00068 
00069 // Effect categorisation. Adds support for arranging effects in categories
00070 // and displaying those categories as submenus in the Effect menu.
00071 #define EFFECT_CATEGORIES
00072 
00073 // Andreas Micheler, 22 Nov.2007
00074 // Some fixes for the rulers.
00075 // If activated, the ruler's labels don't spill over,
00076 // instead all rulers are resized to fit the biggest ruler.
00077 // MJS, 21 April 2008
00078 // With Waveform (dB) view, at some vertical sizes of track, there appears to be a loop
00079 // where the ruler gets bigger and smaller repeatedly, using up an awful lot of cycles.
00080 // Really needs to be fixed before this is turned on.
00081 // MJS, 30 June 2008
00082 // Fixed the loop problem, so turned this on as I think it's valid.
00083 #define EXPERIMENTAL_RULER_AUTOSIZE
00084 
00085 // Andreas Micheler, 20.Nov 2007: 
00086 // A spectrumLogF-like view mode with notes quantization.
00087 // Just select the "Find Notes" checkbox in the spectrum prefs 
00088 // to activate it instead of the Spectrum log(f) mode.
00089 //#define EXPERIMENTAL_FIND_NOTES
00090 
00091 // AM, 22.Nov 2007
00092 // Skip Points support in the spectrum view mode.
00093 //#define EXPERIMENTAL_FFT_SKIP_POINTS
00094 
00095 // AM, 22.Nov 2007: 
00096 // A Frequency Grid for the Spectrum Log(f) & Find Notes modes
00097 //#define EXPERIMENTAL_FFT_Y_GRID
00098 
00099 // AM, 22.Nov 2007: 
00100 // Saves the default view mode for wave tracks.
00101 #define EXPERIMENTAL_SAVE_DEFAULT_VIEW
00102 
00103 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_FEATURES
00104    // The first experimental feature is a notebook that adds
00105    // a tabbed divider to the project.
00106    //#define EXPERIMENTAL_NOTEBOOK
00107    // The notebook in turn can contain:
00108    // 1. The Nyquist Inspector, which is a browser for the objects in 
00109    // Audacity.
00110    //#define EXPERIMENTAL_NYQUIST_INSPECTOR
00111    // 2. The Vocal Studio, a screen for working with vocal sounds
00112    // particularly vowel sounds.
00113    //#define EXPERIMENTAL_VOCAL_STUDIO
00114    // 3. The Audacity Tester is an extended version of the benchmarks
00115    // display.  The crucial idea is to be able to compare waveforms
00116    // where effects have been applied by audacity but using different 
00117    // block-sizes.  This should give high confidence that we don't
00118    // suffer from end-effects on buffers, e.g. losing one sample on
00119    // each buffer.
00120    //#define EXPERIMENTAL_AUDACITY_TESTER
00121 
00122    // A long term plan is to use dso's and dlls for Audacity extensions
00123    // These are 'WX' plug ins that manage their own displays using
00124    // wxWindows.
00125    //#define EXPERIMENTAL_WX_PLUG_INS
00126 #endif
00127

00129 //yet checked in to Audacity CVS as of 10-Oct-2004
